problem.markdown:
>>An open Jackson network is considered feasible if: <<
[x] The system can handle the demand placed on it.
[ ] If \( \lambda_i >= \mu_i \) for all i.
[x] If the system is found to be ergodic.
[ ] If there is an exact analytic solution for the probability distribution. [explanation] If a system can handle the demand placed on it, it is considered feasible. We can express this condition as \( \lambda_i \lt \mu_i \) for all i. If the system is ergodic, there is a unique steady-state solution, implying the queue cannot grow indefinitely, which in turn implies that the system can handle the demand. [explanation]

div.p: If a system can handle the demand placed on it, it is considered feasible. We can express this condition as \( \lambda_i \lt \mu_i \) for all i. If the system is ergodic, there is a unique steady-state solution, implying the queue cannot grow indefinitely, which in turn implies that the system can handle the demand.
